levels.descriptor: Sophisticated analysis showing good understanding of the question. Clear chain of reasoning with relevant economic theory and terminology. Effective evaluation with supported judgment. Diagrams used appropriately where relevant. Demonstrates ability to synthesize multiple concepts.

Good analysis with reasonable understanding. Some use of economic theory and terminology. Attempts at evaluation but may lack full support or depth. Diagrams may be present but not fully exploited. Shows competent application of concepts.

Some understanding but superficial or incomplete analysis. Limited use of economic theory. Little or undeveloped evaluation. Diagrams may be absent or poorly executed. Response shows basic comprehension but lacks development.

Limited understanding of the question. Mainly descriptive with little or no analysis. No real evaluation or judgment. Economic terminology largely absent or misused. Response may be largely irrelevant or brief.

data_response_questions.typical_structure: Extract data → Apply theory → Brief evaluation

acceptable_variations: Different diagram labeling conventions (P/Q vs Price/Quantity)
Supply/demand shift vs supply/demand curve shift (contextually equivalent)
Real vs nominal values (if clarified in context)
common_errors_to_penalize: Incorrect diagram labeling or missing labels
Failure to reference stimulus material when required

diagrams.full_credit: Correctly labeled diagram with clear explanation
diagrams.partial_credit: Diagram present but labels incomplete or explanation weak
diagrams.no_credit: Diagram absent when explicitly required or fundamentally incorrect

evaluation.partial_credit: Some evaluation but one-sided or unsupported
evaluation.no_credit: No evaluation present or purely descriptive

notes: This configuration represents Cambridge Economics 9708 marking standards for Papers 2 and 3 (2018-2023 syllabus). Level descriptors apply primarily to essay questions (typically 20-25 marks). Shorter questions may use simplified rubrics or mark schemes with specific point allocation.
